text: ThinkPalm's Domestic Travel Policy aims to establish clear rules for business travel within India, ensuring employee comfort, convenience, and safety while promoting judicious use of company resources. The policy emphasizes proactive travel arrangements to facilitate hassle-free journeys. A core component is the categorization of employees into four groups—Directors/VPs (Category 1), Senior Managers/Managers (Category 2), Leads/Senior Engineers/Executives (Category 3), and Office Assistants/Trainees (Category 4)—based on their designations. This classification directly determines eligibility and limits for various travel entitlements, ensuring fairness and structure across the organization for all official domestic travel.

text: The Domestic Travel Policy categorizes destinations and types of official travel to streamline guidelines. Destinations are classified as Class A (Delhi, Mumbai, Bangalore), Class B (Chennai, Calcutta, Hyderabad, Pune, Mangalore, Kochi, all State Capitals), and Class C (all other cities). Official travels are distinctively categorized as Business Travel (for meetings, training, visas, conferences) or Project Related Travel (for specific project assignments). Additionally, the policy mandates a professional dress code and appearance, consistent with the company's image, requiring employees to carry their ID cards. Ethical conduct, integrity, respect, cooperation, and building a winning team are fundamental expectations for all employees during business engagements.

text: ThinkPalm's Domestic Travel Policy specifies modes of travel and an approval process. Category 1 employees are eligible for Air Economy, Category 2 for Air/Train II AC/III AC, and Categories 3 & 4 for Train/Bus (II AC/III AC/AC Sleeper/AC Semi Sleeper or II class respectively). All official travel requires authorization through the 'Heads' system, initiated by the traveler at least two weeks prior, ensuring approval by their Reporting Officer/HOD. Advance planning is crucial for cost savings. Approved requests automatically go to Operations and Finance for logistics (tickets, accommodation) and fund advances, which are decided based on travel duration and eligibility, then communicated via email to the employee.

text: The policy outlines strict procedures for changing or cancelling ticketed itineraries. Employees must promptly inform the Operations Department via email with Department Head approval and justification. Any travel advance received must be immediately returned to Finance. Failure to provide timely notification for changes or cancellations may result in penalties charged to the employee, unless it's a no-fault situation. For accommodation, hotel bookings are typically managed by the Operations Department. If an employee books independently, benchmark amounts are specified per city class and employee category (e.g., Category 2: INR 3500 for Class A, INR 2800 for Class B). Relevant bills are mandatory for claim settlement.

text: ThinkPalm Domestic Travel Policy provides a Daily Allowance to cover food and incidental expenses when company-arranged accommodation is provided. The allowance depends on employee category and destination city class. For Business Travel, the daily allowance amounts are: City A Category 1 = 1200, Category 2 = 1000, Category 3 = 700, Category 4 = 500. City B Category 1 = 900, Category 2 = 700, Category 3 = 500, Category 4 = 400. City C Category 1 = 700, Category 2 = 500, Category 3 = 400, Category 4 = 300. For Project Related Travel, the daily allowance amounts are: City A Category 1 = 2000, Category 2 = 1600, Category 3 = 900, Category 4 = 500. City B Category 1 = 1500, Category 2 = 1000, Category 3 = 700, Category 4 = 400. City C Category 1 = 1200, Category 2 = 750, Category 3 = 500, Category 4 = 300. The daily allowance applies from the time of arrival at the destination city and is calculated for every completed 24 hours. For stays of less than 24 hours, employees may claim actual food and incidental expenses not exceeding 70 percent of the applicable daily allowance. In cases of multi-city travel, the allowance is applied as per the destination city. The allowance is not applicable on days when the employee is away from the onsite or client location.

metadata.title: Daily Allowance Policy for Official Travel

text: Employees who opt for self-arranged accommodation are eligible for a Consolidated Daily Allowance, submitted with bills for settlement; claims without bills incur tax deductions. Rates vary by employee category and city class for both Business Travel (e.g., Category 1: INR 1000-2000) and Project Related Travel (e.g., Category 1: INR 1600-3000). For conveyance, employees must choose cost-effective, safe ground transportation (Metro, Ola, Uber, Public Bus). Car rental services should be shared by multiple travelers. Autos are permitted only where other services are unavailable. For project travels exceeding one month at the same location, a monthly allowance of up to INR 1000 (against bills) covers local commute to and from airport/station/residential place.

text: The Domestic Travel Policy details entertainment expenses and travel reporting. Category 1 employees can claim entertainment expenses for business, while Category 2 requires prior email approval from their Department Head. Expenses must be reasonable, serving to develop goodwill or secure new business, with discussions occurring around the entertainment. Extravagance is prohibited, and claims require detailed purpose and guest information. Upon returning from travel, employees must submit all expenses via the 'Heads' system using a Tour Settlement Form within seven days. This form needs Reporting Officer/HOD approval and original itemized receipts. Lost receipts must be explained by the employee and acknowledged by the Reporting Officer/HOD to ensure timely settlements.

metadata.title: Entertainment Expense Policy and Travel Expense Reporting

text: General guidelines for domestic travel include prioritizing company guest houses/apartments, which are non-smoking zones where intoxicating beverages are forbidden. Operations handles most travel bookings, but emergency employee bookings are reimbursed per eligibility. Employees are strictly prohibited from sharing travel itineraries on social media; only immediate personal contacts may receive them for safety. Travelers must depart from onsite locations within one day of assignment completion. Unsettled travel advances beyond one month will be adjusted against salary. New advances are withheld if previous ones are unsettled. For team travel, employees of different grades may share accommodation (twin-sharing, excluding Category 1) to maintain morale. Joint expenses should be claimed by the senior employee, and original itemized receipts are mandatory for all approved expenses, with Finance authorized to deduct non-compliant claims. A travel summary and feedback are expected, and employees should report to the office on the next working day after arrival.

metadata.title: General Guidelines for Domestic Travel and Company Policy Adherence

text: ThinkPalm's Local Travel policy covers cab usage and private vehicle reimbursements. For official work outside office hours, cabs are available after 6:00 PM in two shuttles (8:00 PM, 9:30 PM) for up to 20 km, or to the nearest bus station; female staff receive escorts. Special approval is needed for cabs after 9:30 PM. Weekend/holiday work requires prior Reporting Officer approval and Operations intimation by 6:00 PM the previous day. During office hours, cab requests need a mail to local operations, copied to the reporting officer. Private vehicle usage for official reasons is reimbursed at Rs. 8/km for four-wheelers and Rs. 4/km for two-wheelers, calculated from home or office, whichever is lower. The policy explicitly excludes reimbursement for personal entertainment, grooming, toiletries, excess baggage, fines, family travel, personal property loss due to negligence, and upgrade charges.

text: ThinkPalm's Information Security Policy provides a framework for best practices to be followed by all employees, aiming to minimize risk and ensure effective responses to security incidents. This policy fosters employee participation in safeguarding ThinkPalm's and its clients' information assets, recognizing information as a critical asset requiring protection from unauthorized access, modification, disclosure, and destruction. The objectives are to implement comprehensive information security policies for all ThinkPalm facilities and its network. The scope applies to a broad range of ThinkPalm assets and activities, with the overarching purpose to ensure adequate security measures are implemented to protect and support the company's daily business operations and transactions.

metadata.title: Introduction, Objectives, Scope, and Purpose of ThinkPalm IT Security Policy

text: ThinkPalm's General Security Policy dictates that company-provided computers, electronic media, and services are primarily for business use. While limited personal use is acceptable if it doesn't negatively impact business, employees must exercise responsibility. Key general practices include swiping ID cards for facility entry/exit to prevent tailgating, and refraining from connecting any unauthorized electronic devices or storage mediums without prior IT department or management approval. Employees must not take company or client-supplied devices outside the facility without explicit permission, notifying the IT department via a support ticket. All sensitive information, whether paper or media, must not be left unattended and disposed of properly (e.g., shredding sensitive papers in green boxes) once their retention period expires.

metadata.title: General Security Policy: Employee Responsibilities and Asset Protection

text: As part of ThinkPalm's General Security Policy, all employees are required to familiarize themselves with company security policies and report any breaches by others. Remote desktop connectivity is blocked by default on all machines, enabled only on a need basis with reporting authority approval. Login credentials must remain confidential, and using others' credentials for any services is strictly prohibited. Systems must be locked when unattended. For non-employees or visitors, a visitor's tag is mandatory, and their details must be logged in a visitor's register. Visitors must visibly display their badges, and accompanying employees are responsible for ensuring this compliance. An in-house ISMS team is tasked with framing, reviewing, monitoring, and addressing critical security issues.

metadata.title: General Security Policy: Remote Access, Credentials, Visitors, and ISMS Role

text: The Workstation/Laptop Usage Policy emphasizes desktop security as the entry point to organizational information resources, stating that only the IT infrastructure/Network Administration team is authorized to install, uninstall, or configure software on company devices. Employees are mandated to shut down systems daily to conserve power and lock them when away. A password-protected screen saver with a short timeout (5 minutes preferred) should be enabled. Workstations and laptops are strictly for authorized business purposes, prohibiting games or unauthorized software. If left on for after-hours updates, applications should be exited, and documents closed. Files should be kept organized, hardware handled gently, preinstalled antivirus should be running, and employees must only use their own accounts. Problems should be reported via help desk tickets, email, or phone.

metadata.title: Workstation/Laptop Usage Policy: Authorized Use and Best Practices

text: ThinkPalm's Workstation/Laptop Usage Policy strictly prohibits several actions to maintain system security and integrity. Employees must not install unauthorized software from external sources (Internet, personal media) due to potential malicious code. Saving personal data like photos, songs, or videos on company workstations is forbidden, as is creating junk files or folders. Systems should never be left open, unlocked, or unattended, and personal work on office computers is discouraged. Removing cables from a powered-on PC, seeking unauthorized access to the network, or tampering with systems is unacceptable. Employees are not allowed to bring removable devices/disks into computer rooms, swap equipment between computers, or consume eatables/beverages at workstations to prevent accidental spills and infestations.

metadata.title: Workstation/Laptop Usage Policy: Prohibited Actions and Security Don'ts

text: The Email Use Policy is established to facilitate efficient and effective staff communication for duties, while preventing illegal or inappropriate use of time and resources. Employees are mandated to keep their mail client open and check messages daily, using email for all official/project-related communications. Meeting requests require timely responses, and all messages must include a meaningful subject line, with recipients carefully verified before sending. Deleting no longer required emails and respecting copyright for data and software are expected. Reporting spam and phishing emails to the administrator is crucial for filtering. Every outgoing company email must include an official signature, and email passwords should be renewed monthly to enhance security.

metadata.title: Email Use Policy: Communication Guidelines and Best Practices

text: ThinkPalm's Email Use Policy prohibits sending jokes to large mailing lists, printing emails unnecessarily, or using 'Reply All' when only the sender needs to be informed. Large attachments should be avoided unless official, with FTP recommended for such files. Employees must refrain from subscribing to news sites, blogs, or forums with official email IDs to prevent spam, and should never reply to spam mails. Opening email attachments from unreliable or unexpected sources is forbidden; callers should verify with the sender. Sending sensitive data like IDs and passwords via email is prohibited, as is sending official information from third-party email providers. Finally, employees must not use email to transmit confidential, political, obscene, threatening, offensive, or libelous material. Emails older than two years are auto-archived by the server and accessible online.

metadata.title: Email Use Policy: Prohibited Actions, Data Sensitivity, and Archiving

text: The Internet Policy at ThinkPalm aims to ensure efficient use of time and prevent illegal or inappropriate internet usage, as access is provided to staff to assist in their duties. Employees are expected to keep their internet use to a minimum. When accessing information online, it is crucial to check for accuracy, completeness, and currency, and to validate the information found. Additionally, all employees must respect legal protections covering data and software, including copyright and licenses. These guidelines ensure responsible and productive internet usage that aligns with the company's operational and security standards, preventing misuse and upholding legal and ethical obligations in the digital realm.

metadata.title: Internet Use Policy: Responsible Access and Data Verification

text: ThinkPalm's Internet Use Policy outlines several prohibitions to maintain security and productivity. Employees should avoid public instant messaging services (Skype, Yahoo, MSN, Gtalk) during office hours and refrain from downloading unnecessary software, songs, or videos that consume significant bandwidth. Using public email services (Hotmail, Gmail, Yahoo) and installing software like torrents or download accelerators is forbidden. Visiting objectionable websites (bad language, pornography) is strictly prohibited and centrally monitored, with warnings issued for violations. Employees are also discouraged from visiting casual websites during office hours. Misusing the internet to defraud, harass, or defame others, making unauthorized entries into other computers/networks, or transmitting confidential, political, obscene, threatening, or harassing materials is unacceptable.

metadata.title: Internet Use Policy: Prohibited Activities and Content

text: The Password Policy at ThinkPalm establishes standards for strong password creation, protection, and frequency of change. To protect passwords, employees must avoid writing them down visibly, sending them via email, including them in non-encrypted documents, or revealing them over the telephone or to anyone. The use of 'Remember Password' features in applications is prohibited. Any suspicion of a compromised password must be immediately reported to the IT Infrastructure/Network Administration team. When creating passwords, guidelines include a recommended minimum length of 8 characters (maximum 14), and minimum complexity requiring no dictionary words. Passwords should incorporate at least three or four character types: lowercase, uppercase, numbers, and special characters (!@#$%^&*(){}[]).

metadata.title: Password Policy: Protection and Creation Guidelines

text: Building on ThinkPalm's Password Policy, passwords are case-sensitive, unlike usernames or login IDs. Specific attributes for password management include a maximum password age of 60 days for Domain, SVN, and ThinkPalm Web-Mail, compelling regular updates. To prevent immediate reuse, a minimum password reset age of 2 days is enforced. Furthermore, an account lockout threshold is set at 4 failed login attempts, designed to protect accounts from brute-force attacks by temporarily disabling access after repeated incorrect entries. These measures collectively bolster the security of employee accounts and organizational systems, minimizing vulnerabilities associated with weak or compromised passwords.

metadata.title: Password Policy: Advanced Attributes and Account Security

text: The Removable Media Policy addresses the significant risks of malware infections and sensitive information loss associated with removable media. ThinkPalm staff are permitted to use only ThinkPalm-owned removable media in their work computers, provided such use is authorized. Connecting ThinkPalm media to non-company-owned or leased computers is prohibited without explicit management permission. Sensitive information should only be stored on removable media when essential for assigned duties. Once no longer required, the contents of any re-usable media to be removed from the organization must be completely erased or destroyed. This policy ensures strict control over data transfer and storage, minimizing exposure to security threats from external devices.

metadata.title: Removable Media Policy: Authorized Use, Data Storage, and Disposal

text: ThinkPalm's Network/Storage Usage Policy establishes guidelines for staff to ensure network integrity and data security. Employees unable to access the network must contact support staff rather than tampering with settings or cables. Unauthorized access to networks or computers is strictly prohibited. To prevent network congestion, sending unnecessary chain mails is forbidden. For sharing large files, employees should use the common folder on the file server instead of email or sharing personal directories, with recipients deleting files after copying. Storing MP3 or other entertainment/personal media files in the shared space on the ThinkPalm File Server is not allowed. Furthermore, employees working at client sites must take extra precautions to prevent leaving source code on client machines unless explicitly required for project commitments, and proper source code backing up is essential during development activities at client sites. Information security is paramount for organizational success and credibility, ensuring client data and intellectual property are safe.

text: This International Travel Policy aims to establish clear rules for official international travel and expenses, ensuring employee comfort, judicious use of company resources, pre-arranged travel, and timely expense reimbursement. To manage travel entitlement limits, employees are categorized into three groups: Category 1 includes Directors and Vice Presidents; Category 2 comprises Sr. General Manager, General Manager, Delivery Manager, Senior Manager, Manager, Project Manager, Associate Manager, Senior Test Architect, Company Secretary, Senior Technical Architect, and Technical Architect; Category 3 encompasses all other roles, from Senior Project Lead to Technical Writer. text: Employees undertaking international travel are expected to uphold ThinkPalm Technologies' professional image through appropriate dress code and appearance, commensurate with their role. Carrying the company-issued identity card is mandatory for travelers to other sites. Furthermore, employee conduct abroad must align with the company's core tenets: integrity, respect for individuals, cooperation, and fostering a winning team. The policy mandates maintaining the highest ethical standards in all business relationships, extending to colleagues, customers, vendors, and even competitors. This ensures a consistent professional representation and adherence to company values while on official international duty.

text: The international travel approval process requires the traveler to possess a passport valid for at least six months post-return and initiate the visa process through their Reporting Officer, submitting documents to the Operations Department. All official travel and requests for travel arrangements, including advances, must be authorized by concerned Department Heads. Travelers should initiate processes well in advance to secure cost savings on bookings. Funds are advanced via Travel Currency Card or Currency by the Finance Department based on travel duration and eligible allowance. The Operations Department handles tickets, overseas Mediclaim policy, and accommodation bookings (company guesthouse/apartment/hotel). E-tickets, Mediclaim, and accommodation details are then communicated to the employee via email.

metadata.title: International Travel Approval and Booking Process

text: Employees must promptly inform the Operations Department via email, with Department Head approval and justification, of any changes or cancellations to their international travel plans. If the return date needs modification for project reasons, early notification to Operations is crucial. Changes often incur airline date change fees and fare differences. Serious consideration is required before altering return dates or extending travel insurance, as expired Overseas Travel Insurance cannot be renewed. Failure to maintain continuous insurance coverage while abroad can lead to significant company financial liability during medical emergencies. Timely communication is vital to prevent irreversible damage and ensure continuous coverage.

text: During international travel and stay, daily allowances cover meals and incidental/personal expenses from arrival to departure, varying by geographic location and country. For travel exceeding a month, remaining foreign currency on travel cards is encashed into the company account post-claim submission, with the employee's final eligible amount paid with their salary. text: The Employee Base Policy covers various benefits, including Domiciliary Hospitalization and Pre-Post Hospitalization expenses (30 days pre, 60 days post). Pre and Post Natal expenses, and Well Baby Expenses are covered within the Maternity Limit. Room Rent Capping is set at INR 5,000 for normal rooms and INR 8,000 for ICU, with pro-rata deductions if limits are exceeded. A 50% co-pay applies to Cyberknife treatment and stem cell transplantation. Cochlear Implants are covered at 50% of the Sum Insured, requiring HR confirmation. Standard hospitalization, TPA services, Pre-Existing Diseases, and waivers for 1st-year and 30-day exclusions are included. Maternity benefits are INR 50,000 for normal delivery and INR 65,000 for C-section, with baby cover from Day 1. Ambulance services are covered up to INR 1,000 per claim. Ayurvedic treatment is covered in Govt. Registered/NABH Accredited Hospitals. Psychiatric treatment has a sub-limit of 25% of the Sum Insured. Congenital External conditions are covered, and Stem Cell treatment is covered up to 50% of SI, with a maximum of INR 2.5 Lakh. Commencement dates vary: July 27, 2025, for existing members, date of joining for new joiners, and date of event for new dependents.

text: Maternity benefits for the Employee Base Policy include INR 50,000 for normal delivery and INR 65,000 for C-sections. These benefits are restricted to a maximum of two children, and the 9-month waiting period is waived. Pre and Post Natal expenses are covered within the maternity limit, but Well Baby & Mother Expenses are explicitly not covered. Admissibility requires hospitalization in India and covers the first two children only; those with two or more living children are ineligible. Expenses for voluntary medical termination of pregnancy within the first 12 weeks of conception are not covered. Newborn baby details must be updated in the internal tool within 30 days of birth. For cashless hospitalization on the day of birth, the HR team must be informed in advance.

text: Hospitalization expenses are payable provided they are incurred in India and within the policy period, with reimbursement based on the member's coverage level. Generally, a minimum 24-hour hospitalization period is required, but this does not apply to specific treatments like Dialysis, Chemotherapy, Radiotherapy, Eye surgery (for refractory error +/- 7.5 correction index), Lithotripsy, Tonsillectomy, and D&C, which are admissible even if discharged on the same day. Covered expenses include Room and Boarding (with nursing, DMO/RMO charges), Doctors/Medical Practitioner fees, Intensive Care Unit, Nursing expenses, Surgical fees, operating theatre, anesthesia, oxygen, drugs, hospital miscellaneous services (lab, x-ray, diagnostics), Radiotherapy, Chemotherapy, and Surrogacy benefits (up to maternity limit). Claims are admissible only with an 'active line of treatment', meaning investigations or treatments consistent and incidental to the diagnosis and treatment of an ailment requiring confinement. Claims are not payable for hospitalization involving only oral medication/injections, investigations without positive outcomes, outpatient treatments, physiotherapy only, or evaluation purposes.

metadata.title: Hospitalization Coverage, Eligibility, and Active Treatment Requirements

text: The policy defines and covers Pre-Hospitalization and Post-Hospitalization expenses. Pre-Hospitalization expenses cover medical treatment directly related to an illness leading to hospitalization for up to 30 days prior to admission, provided the hospitalization claim is accepted. Post-Hospitalization expenses cover further medical treatment directly related to the condition for which the insured member was hospitalized, for up to 60 days immediately following discharge, again, contingent on an accepted hospitalization claim. Both Pre- and Post-Hospitalization expenses are covered under the policy.

text: Cashless hospitalization allows the Administrator (Medi Assist) to directly settle eligible service charges with a Network Hospital, meaning the insured person may not need to pay deposits or bills for covered services. An updated list of network hospitals is available on the Medi Assist link (https://network.medibuddy.in/). It is crucial for employees to verify the cashless facility directly with the hospital before treatment, as tie-ups can change. Although the main hospitalization is cashless, claims for pre and post-hospitalization expenses still require separate submission of bills and documents for reimbursement.

text: For Emergency Hospitalization, the process involves three key steps. Step 1: Admission. The member should get admitted to the nearest network hospital by showing their ID card. Step 2: Pre-Authorization. Relatives must inform the call center within 24 hours of admission to seek pre-authorization. The pre-authorization letter is sent directly to the hospital; if denied, the member is informed. Step 3: Treatment & Discharge. Once pre-authorized, the employee is not required to pay the hospitalization bill at a network hospital, as the Administrator settles it. The member only pays for non-medical expenses like refreshments. After discharge, the hospital sends the complete claim documents to the Administrator for processing.

metadata.title: Emergency Cashless Hospitalization Procedure

text: For Planned Hospitalization, pre-authorization is mandatory at least 48 hours in advance. Step 1: Pre-Authorization. The member intimates the Administrator using a specified format. This ensures optimal healthcare and avoids inconvenience during admission to a Network Hospital. The Administrator then authorizes cashless services as per SLA. Step 2: Admission, Treatment & Discharge. Upon pre-authorization, a letter of credit is issued to the hospital. The member presents their ID card for admission, gets treated, and is discharged after paying non-entitled benefits. The Administrator directly settles the hospitalization bill with the network hospital. Note: The Administrator may renegotiate the final bill with the hospital at discharge to optimize Sum Insured utilization, requiring patience for final approval.

metadata.title: Planned Cashless Hospitalization Procedure

text: For Non-Cashless Hospitalization (reimbursement), members must liaise directly with non-network hospitals for admission, though following the pre-authorization procedure is advised to confirm eligibility. At discharge, members clear all bills and collect necessary documents like discharge summaries and investigation reports. The final claim with all relevant documents must be submitted to Mediassist for reimbursement within 60 days from discharge. The reimbursement process involves the member intimating Mediassist before or during hospitalization, making all payments, and submitting documents to the helpdesk within 30 days of discharge. Mediassist performs medical scrutiny and checks document sufficiency. If valid, the claim is processed, and payment is made to the employee's account; otherwise, deficiency mails are sent or the claim is rejected if documents are late or incomplete.

Follow-up advice/letter after discharge, and breakup details for pharmacy items, materials, and investigations are necessary. For non-registered or non-network hospitals, a letter on hospital letterhead mentioning the number of beds, round-the-clock doctors/nurses, and doctor's registration numbers is required. text: The ThinkPalm Pte Ltd Singapore Leave Policy aims to foster work-life balance and address employees' personal and medical needs by outlining statutory leave and holiday entitlements. Applicable to all probationers and permanent employees, this policy ensures compliance with Singapore's regulations. The leave year runs from January 1st to December 31st, with eligible leave credited annually on January 1st. New hires receive pro-rated leave based on completed months of service. The policy details Annual Leave, Sick Leave, Compensatory Off, and Public Holidays. Importantly, leave is not an absolute right; sanctioning remains at Management's discretion, considering business exigencies or case seriousness.

metadata.title: ThinkPalm Pte Ltd: Purpose, Scope, and General Principles of Leave Policy

text: ThinkPalm Pte Ltd's Annual Leave policy grants 21 working days per calendar year, credited at the year's start. This entitlement is pro-rated for employees joining mid-year or with less than one year of service, and credited only after completing three months of employment. Leave taken before this three-month mark is unpaid. Employees can avail a maximum of 15 working days at one time. Up to 10 unused annual leave days can be carried forward to the next calendar year, but these will be forfeited if not utilized by the end of that subsequent year. Upon an employee's separation, accumulated unused annual leave, up to a maximum of 10 days, will be encashed based on a specified gross pay formula.

metadata.title: ThinkPalm Pte Ltd: Annual Leave Entitlement, Accrual, Carry-forward, and Encashment

text: ThinkPalm Pte Ltd employees are entitled to 14 days of outpatient sick leave and up to 60 days of hospitalization leave (which includes sick leave days), provided they have completed a minimum of three months of service. To qualify for paid sick leave, a medical professional must certify the employee's unfitness for work. Any outpatient sick leave exceeding the 14-day entitlement will be classified as unpaid. For employees with less than a calendar year of service, both paid sick leave and paid hospitalization leave are pro-rated based on months of service, starting from 5 days sick leave and 15 days hospitalization leave after 3 months. Unused sick leave balances lapse at the end of each calendar year and cannot be carried forward or encashed.

metadata.title: ThinkPalm Pte Ltd: Sick Leave Policy, Eligibility, Pro-ration, and Limitations

text: ThinkPalm Pte Ltd's policy for Compensatory Off allows employees to take an alternative working day off if they are required to work on a public holiday for an important assignment, subject to prior approval from their reporting manager. This compensatory off must be utilized within 90 days from the date worked, otherwise, it will lapse. Employees may combine a maximum of two compensatory off days at a stretch and can also combine them with other types of leave or holidays. The company officially recognizes 11 public holidays observed by the Singapore government, including New Year’s Day, Chinese New Year, Hari Raya Puasa, Labor Day, National Day, Deepavali, and Christmas Day. The complete list of public holidays for the calendar year is accessible via the HEADS system.

metadata.title: ThinkPalm Pte Ltd: Compensatory Off and Public Holiday Policy

text: To apply for leave at ThinkPalm Pte Ltd, employees must check their available balance and submit an online application via the HEADS system. The reporting manager holds the authority to approve or disapprove leave requests based on valid grounds. In unavoidable circumstances where leave is taken without prior sanction, the employee must notify their reporting manager by phone on the same day. Following re-joining duty, the approved leave application must reach the HR department within three working days. Reporting managers can cancel sanctioned leave due to situational or business needs; availing such cancelled leave will be treated as absence from duty. Employees wishing to cancel approved leave must inform both their reporting manager and HR.

metadata.title: ThinkPalm Pte Ltd: Leave Application and Cancellation Procedures

text: ThinkPalm Pte Ltd considers absence from duty without prior approval or proper intimation as unauthorized, resulting in Loss of Pay. Upon rejoining, the employee must report to their manager and provide valid written reasons. Severe consequences apply for prolonged absence: unauthorized absence or overstaying granted leave for eight consecutive days (including public holidays) leads to loss of lien on appointment. Management will conduct an inquiry and take appropriate action. If an employee fails to respond to official correspondence within a stipulated time, it will be assumed they have voluntarily withdrawn their service from the company. Overstaying any unsanctioned leave will also be treated as absence from duty, incurring the associated penalties.

metadata.title: ThinkPalm Pte Ltd: Policy on Absence from Duty and Consequences

text: ThinkPalm Pte Ltd's policy states that an employee who resigns while on leave is considered to have voluntarily abandoned service, with the company retaining sole discretion over resignation acceptance from the last working day. During the notice period, employees are limited to one annual leave per month, up to a maximum of three days total; any other leave taken will extend the notice period, especially for project-allocated employees. Standard working hours are 9 AM to 6 PM, Monday to Friday, totaling 9 hours daily with a 30-minute lunch break. Absences are categorized: less than 4.15 hours worked is a full day's leave, and less than 6.0 hours is a half day's leave. Working hours may be adjusted on a case-by-case basis to align with customer time zones.

text: Casual Leave (CL) is granted for casual exigencies and personal emergencies. Employees are entitled to 12 days annually, credited on a pro-rata basis for those joining mid-year (full month for 1st-15th joiners, half month for 16th-31st). A minimum of half CL can be availed, with a maximum of three consecutive days, though management may approve longer durations. National, festival, declared, or weekly off days can be prefixed/suffixed and intervening holidays are not counted. Unutilized CL lapses on December 31st. During probation, employees receive one CL per month, credited at the start of the month, for a maximum of one leave per month.

metadata.title: Casual Leave (CL) Policy

text: Earned Leave (EL) accrues at a rate of 1 EL for every 20 days worked in the previous month, credited on the first working day to permanent staff and probationers. Loss of Pay (LOP) days, including intervening weekends if LOP spans Monday to Friday, do not count towards EL eligibility. EL requires prior approval, and while national/declared/festival/weekly off days can be prefixed/suffixed, intervening holidays are not part of the leave count. Half-day EL is not permitted. Unutilized EL can be carried forward up to a maximum accumulation of 60 days, with any excess lapsing. Upon resignation, EL balance may be adjusted against the notice period with senior management approval. EL cannot be combined with Casual Leave (CL).

text: ThinkPalm Technologies provides Maternity Leave (ML) to female married employees for maternity and related health needs, effective April 1, 2017. Entitlement is 26 weeks for up to two surviving children and 12 weeks for more than two children. For the 26-week leave, up to 8 weeks can be taken before the expected delivery date, with the remaining 18 weeks post-childbirth. Women expecting after two children are entitled to 12 weeks (6 pre and 6 post-delivery). Adoptive mothers are granted 12 weeks of maternity leave from the date of adoption. Notably, intervening national, declared, festival, or weekly off days are counted as part of maternity leave.

metadata.title: Maternity Leave (ML) Policy

text: Miscarriage Leave is provided to female married employees due to miscarriage and related health needs. Employees are entitled to 6 weeks of paid leave upon presenting a medical certificate from a Registered Medical Practitioner, with leave commencing from the date of miscarriage. Intervening national, declared, festival, or weekly off days are counted as part of this leave. If extended leave is required due to complications, it can be arranged with HR department approval, but such extensions will be categorized as Loss of Pay (LOP).

metadata.title: Miscarriage Leave Policy

text: ThinkPalm Technologies offers Paternity Leave to male employees on becoming a parent or upon adoption of a child, effective November 1, 2015. Employees are required to apply for the availed Paternity Leave in the Heads system upon their resumption of duties.

text: Leave Travel Allowance (LTA) is available to employees as a leave type for tax exemption purposes, effective April 1, 2018. LTA can be applied once per financial year, is deducted from the EL balance, and requires three consecutive working days between Monday and Friday for the leave component. To claim tax exemption, LTA must be applied before travel within India, and relevant travel documents must be submitted as proof, adhering to the rules and conditions specified in the Income Tax Act 1961.

text: Upon receiving a sexual harassment complaint, the Committee may, at the aggrieved woman's request, initiate a conciliation process with the respondent. If a settlement is mutually agreed upon during conciliation, no further investigation will be conducted by the Committee, unless the respondent fails to comply with the settlement terms. It is strictly stipulated that no monetary settlement can be sought through this conciliation process. The Committee is responsible for recording the agreed statement and providing copies to both the aggrieved woman and the respondent. Furthermore, the Committee has the right to grant the aggrieved woman reasonable leave from work, which can be extended as deemed necessary, ensuring her well-being; this leave is supplementary to her existing entitlements.

text: The formal investigation into a sexual harassment complaint adheres to principles of natural justice. The Committee must send a copy of the complaint to the respondent within seven working days, who then has ten working days to submit a reply, documents, and witness details. Inquiries require a minimum quorum of three Committee members, including the Presiding Officer. The Committee holds the power to terminate proceedings or issue ex-parte decisions if either party misses three consecutive hearings without sufficient cause, provided fifteen days' prior written notice is given. Legal practitioners are prohibited from representing parties. The Committee possesses civil court powers for inquiries, including summoning individuals, examining under oath, and compelling document production. All inquiries must be completed within ninety days.

text: Sexual harassment is defined as any unwelcome sexual behavior, whether physical, verbal, or non-verbal, that creates an offensive or hostile work environment. Physical harassment encompasses unwanted contact such as touching, patting, pinching, hugging, kissing, or sexual assault. Verbal harassment includes sexually demeaning comments, inappropriate jokes, whistling, yelling, threatening language, sexually colored remarks, or requests for sexual favors. Non-verbal harassment involves showing pornography, sending sexually loaded emails/messages, leering, staring, or making obscene gestures. text: Sexual harassment manifests in distinct types, primarily categorized as Quid Pro Quo and Hostile Environment. Quid Pro Quo harassment involves an implied or explicit promise of preferential treatment or a threat of detrimental treatment concerning an individual's employment or future employment status in exchange for sexual favors. A hostile environment is created when unwelcome sexual behavior interferes with an individual's work, leading to an intimidating, offensive, or humiliating work atmosphere. This can also include treatment likely to affect an employee's health or safety. Recognizing these types helps in identifying situations where an individual's career or well-being is negatively impacted by sexual misconduct, necessitating immediate action.

text: It is crucial to distinguish sexual harassment from other workplace interactions and actions. Administrative actions, such as changing work assignments, restructuring teams, or moving personnel, are generally not considered harassment. Similarly, performance evaluation feedback, including assessments of unsatisfactory work conduct or negative performance reviews, falls outside the definition of harassment. Disagreements among colleagues or with management are also distinct from harassment. These actions, while potentially unwelcome, are typically part of legitimate business operations and professional feedback mechanisms. Understanding these distinctions helps clarify the scope of the sexual harassment policy and prevents misinterpretations, focusing prevention efforts on genuine instances of sexual misconduct.
